bibl.title: Letter from George A. Kellogg to Philip Showalter Hench, May 26, 1942

div1.p: Kellogg thanks Hench for his corrections of the text on “Conquerors of Yellow Fever,” to be included in the booklet of Cornwell paintings.

div1.head: Letter from George A. Kellogg to Philip Showalter Hench, May 26, 1942
div1.opener:
GEORGE A. KELLOGG
41 EAST 42ND STREET
NEW YORK, N.Y.
May 26, 1942.
Dear Dr. Hench,
div1.p:
Many thanks for your careful analysis
of the story we submitted on “Conquerors of Yellow
Fever” some time ago. I think that we have made the
corrections suggested although at the time I saw the
proof on Friday I didn't have your letter at hand. I
am sending you a corrected proof within the next couple
of days. We expect to have copies of the booklet by
each cover at the luncheon at Atlantic City on June 8.
I hope both you and Mrs. Hench are going to find it
possible to come.
div1.closer:
Sincerely, George A. Kellogg L Dr. Philip S. Hench
The Mayo Clinic
Rochester
Minnesota
P.S.
We had almost taken it for granted that
newspaper publicity on the last picture would be prac-
tically impossible because of the war. This does not
seem to be the case as more newspapers seem to be in-
terested in the painting about McDowell as well as the
series of paintings than have been interested any pre-
vious year. Mr. Greene, our publicity representative,
tells us that it is like a snowball and the interest
grows with the addition of each painting.
L
G. A. K.
